matter in issue.definition: a matter that is in dispute as part or all of a legal issue

matter of fact.definition: a matter primarily involving proof or evidence rather than a question of law

matter of form.definition: a matter concerning form or details often of a relatively inessential nature rather than substance [a petition invalid because of a]

matter of law.definition: a matter involving or consisting of the application of law [entitled to judgment as a""]

matter of record.definition: a matter (as a fact) entered on the record of a court or other official body [the security interest was a]

matter of substance.definition: a matter concerning the merits of a case rather than form or relatively inessential details
